data.name: TeleworkingDays
data.value: I am requesting to telework on the following frequency:

data.name: WorkingAloneDesc1
data.value: Refer to the Working Alone Directive for the definition of working alone.

data.name: WorkingAloneDesc2
data.value: If the conditions of your work arrangement meet the definition of working alone, you must speak to your immediate supervisor to discuss a working alone plan.

data.name: SelectGroupApply
data.value: Select which group applies to you:

data.name: StepInfo
data.value: Employees and Managers must review the applicable policy instruments and other required information related to work arrangements.

data.name: EndDateDesc
data.value: (cannot be beyond one year of start date):

data.name: TeleworkingDaysDesc1
data.value: Your hours of work must comply with your collective agreement or terms and conditions of employment.

data.name: TeleworkingDaysDesc2
data.value: Your work arrangement agreement is conditional on your supervisor and delegated manager’s approval and meeting operational requirements. On occasion, there may be operational requirements that require a change to the agreement.

data.name: TeleworkingDaysDesc4
data.value: International telework agreements require deputy minister approval and are only granted on an exceptional basis. Employees should speak to their immediate supervisor to discuss the process for this type of request.

data.name: TeleworkPeriod
data.value: Work Arrangement Period (Work arrangement cannot exceed one year and may be reviewed earlier)

data.name: TeleworkPeriodDesc
data.value: Transport Canada (TC) employees, employees from other government departments and private contractors are not authorized to travel outside of Canada with TC-issued devices and assets (smartphones, tablets and notebooks) or to access TC information due to increased cyber-security threats. Any access to TC’s network outside of Canada is prohibited, whether it be through TC-issued devices or personal devices.

data.name: OHSCheckListDesc1
data.value:
The same occupational health and safety standards must be met in a telework space as in a TC worksite. This checklist identifies the requirements under
the Canada Labour Code, Part II which outlines management's roles and responsibilities. This checklist is an integral part of the work arrangement agreement between the employer and employee and can assist the employee and their supervisor, in determining whether the telework location provides a safe and healthy work environment.

data.name: OHSCheckListDesc2
data.value: If you check “NO” in any section of this Occupational Health and Safety Checklist, you must speak to your immediate supervisor to discuss what, if any mitigation measures will be required.

data.name: TermConfirmMutualAgreement
data.value: I understand that this agreement may be reviewed, modified or terminated as per the TC Guidelines for Telework Arrangements.

data.name: TermMandatoryTrainingList4
data.value: W101 Harassment and Violence Prevention for Employees

data.name: TermMandatoryTrainingList5
data.value: W102 Harassment and Violence Prevention for Managers, and OHS Committees/Representatives

data.name: TermWorkingAloneDesc
data.value: You must ensure that if you are working alone, that you have reviewed the TC Working Alone Directive and have arranged with your supervisor to develop and abide by a working alone plan (if applicable).

data.name: TermWorkplaceAccidentDesc
data.value:
I recognize that the Crown will not be held liable for an employee’s negligent misuse of government equipment that results in damages to the employee’s personal or real property during the performance of official duties or while using government equipment at the employee’s telework location.

I have completed or will complete the TC-required OHS training. I commit to maintaining a safe personal telework workspace. I recognize that my employer is responsible for my telework work tasks only, not for my entire home. I agree to report to my supervisor any accident, injury, illness, discomfort, ergonomic issues and hazards as soon as possible. Any accident, injury or illness arising from teleworking will only be considered work-related if arising from the performance of my work-related duties.

Transport Canada reserves the right to inspect the telework location I have identified. I recognize that in the event of a workplace accident, I may be required to allow access to investigators to perform their duties and recommend the appropriate corrective action and non-cooperation may impact my WAA.

Note : If you have any questions regarding the above conditions, contact your manager or Regional OHS Advisor, where applicable.

data.name: OhsChekListSubTitle
data.value: Please review and complete the checklist for the telework location

data.name: OhsWarning
data.value: Please discuss the unmet conditions with your supervisor to see what, if any mitigation measures need to be taken.

data.name: DiscussWithManager

data.name: OccupationalHealthSafetyChecklistDesc
data.value: Please review and complete the checklist for the telework location

data.name: SummaryDetailHeading
data.value: Confirmation of your Work Arrangement Agreement Request

data.name: WorkTypeSelectionInfo1
data.value: If you are employed on a part-time basis, only select the actual workdays when you will be teleworking. Do not fill in the other days.

data.name: RequestReviewedByDesc
data.value: To save or print, select the CTRL+P function. Under Printer, either select Save to PDF or select your local printer.

data.name: DutyToAccommodate
data.value: Is your request related to a duty to accommodate?

data.name: DutyToAccommodateDesc1
data.value: A duty to accommodate situation applies to needs related to the grounds of discrimination under the Canadian Human Rights Act where the employer has an obligation to adjust rules, polices or practices to enable you to participate fully. (Requirements can be found in the TB Directive on Duty to Accommodate)

data.name: DutyToAccommodateDesc2
data.value: You must speak with your immediate supervisor for them to better understand the request for duty to accommodate. Any information you provide is protected under the Privacy Act. It will only be used to address duty to accommodate needs.

data.name: PrivacyStatement
data.value: Privacy Notice Statement – For use by Transport Canada – Work Arrangement Agreement

data.name: PrivacyStatementDesc
data.value: The purpose of collecting and using this information is to fulfill your employer's responsibility to ensure the health and safety of employees in their work arrangements whether on-site or off-site. Any personal information provided is collected pursuant to section 7 and 11.1 of the Financial Administration Act and will be used and disclosed in accordance with the Privacy Act, as described in the Personal Information Bank, entitled Occupational Health and Safety - PSE 907. Aggregated information may be used for management reporting to assist in planning and program evaluation purposes. You have the right to request access to and correction of, your personal information. Should you wish to exercise your rights under the Privacy Act or have any questions about this privacy statement, please contact Transport Canada’s Access to Information and Privacy Office. Should you wish to lodge a complaint with respect to the handling of your personal information, you may do so by contacting the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada.

data.name: UpdateEmergencyContactInfo
data.value: To continue, please update your emergency contact information, find out how by clicking here. Once the information is entered, you must either close or refresh your browser to continue.

data.name: OHSCheckListDesc3

data.name: TermITIM
data.value: Information Technology, Information Management and Security of Information

data.name: TermITIMList1
data.value: I agree to use equipment and electronic networks belonging to the employer only for the purposes of carrying out the employee’s work unless otherwise authorized by the supervisor and/or described in the TBS Guideline on Acceptable Network and Device Use.

data.name: TermITIMList2
data.value: I agree to take all reasonable precautions to protect the equipment used and to take responsibility for the safeguarding of information (physical or electronic) at the telework location in accordance with the TC Protected and Classified Information Standard.

data.name: TermITIMList3
data.value: I agree to manage information of business value according to the requirements under the Access to Information Act and the Privacy Act.

data.name: TermITIMList4
data.value: I agree to store information of business value with a security level up to and including Protected B in Transport Canada's approved databases or its official document repository RDIMS according to the TC Information Management Directive.

data.name: TermITIMList5
data.value: I will ensure that a secure internet connection is used at my telework location at my telework location, and that to reduce risk of a cybersecurity breach, unsecure publicly available internet connections will not be used.

data.name: TermITIMList6
data.value: I agree to review the guidance provided by the Canadian Centre for Cyber Security ITSAP.00.087 Mobile Devices and Business travelers.

data.name: GEOCodeTooltip
data.value: The position GEO location (GEO Code), assigned by Statistics Canada, identifies the geographic location of the physical location of a position at its designated workplace in Canada

data.name: ConsiderItemGuidance2
data.value: For additional information on GEO codes, please read GEO Code Location - Requirements and Considerations

data.name: TooltipsTMX
data.value:
TMX Members:
  • Deputy Minister
  • Associate Deputy Minister
  • Assistant Deputy Minister, Corporate Services and Chief Financial Officer
  • Assistant Deputy Minister, Policy
  • Assistant Deputy Minister, Programs
  • Assistant Deputy Minister, Safety and Security
  • Associate Assistant Deputy Minister, Safety and Security
  • Assistant Deputy Minister, Transformation
  • Regional Director General, Atlantic Region
  • Regional Director General, Quebec Region
  • Regional Director General, Ontario Region
  • Regional Director General, Prairie and Northern Region
  • Assistant Deputy Minister, Pacific Region
  • Senior General Counsel and Executive Director, Legal Services
  • Director General, Communications and Marketing
  • Chief Audit and Evaluation Executive

data.name: PartTimeScheduleDesc
data.value: If you are employed on a part-time basis, indicate only the actual workdays where you will be teleworking. E.g., an employee working on a part-time three days a week schedule, teleworking all three days, would equate to a 10-14 days range.

data.name: MsgFTR
data.value: This is a Full-time Remote agreement. Only TMX members can approve.
